inputs.description: -seed        seed number for random number generator (for S and R above)
inputs.name: SEED

inputs.description: -sseed       seed string for random number generator (for S and R above)
inputs.name: SSEED

inputs.description: -column      writes output, one number per line (with root and suffix, if any)
inputs.name: COLUMN

inputs.description: -form CFRM   print the numbers with the CFRM formatting string. e.g.: count -form %c 49 130 or count -form '%03d<:-)' 97 99 You can't use any type of C formatting, only those who take an integer for an input. Using '%f', or '%s' will cause a crash.
inputs.name: FORM

inputs.description: -root rrr    prints string 'rrr' before the number [default=empty]
inputs.name: ROOT

inputs.description: -sep s       prints single character 's' between the numbers [default=blank] [normally you would not use '-sep' with '-column']
inputs.name: SEP

inputs.description: -suffix sss  prints string 'sss' after the number [default=empty]
inputs.name: SUFFIX

inputs.description: -scale fff   multiplies each number by the factor 'fff'; if this option is used, -digits is ignored and the floating point format '%g' is used for output. ('fff' can be a floating point number.)
inputs.name: SCALE

inputs.description: -comma       put commas between the outputs, instead of spaces (same as '-sep ,')
inputs.name: COMMA

inputs.description: -skipnmodm n m   skip over numbers with a modulus of n with m
inputs.name: SKIPNMODM
